kou commented on pull request #4129: ARROW-5146: [Dev] Fix project name inference in merge script
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4129#discussion_r273777308
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/merge_arrow_pr.py
 ##########
 @@ -378,9 +378,8 @@ def merge(self, target_ref='master'):
 
 def cli():
     # Location of your Arrow git clone
-    SEP = os.path.sep
-    ARROW_HOME = os.path.abspath(__file__).rsplit(SEP, 2)[0]
-    PROJECT_NAME = ARROW_HOME.rsplit(SEP, 1)[1]
+    ARROW_HOME = os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__))
+    PROJECT_NAME = os.environ.get('ARROW_PROJECT_NAME', '') or 'arrow'
 
 Review comment:
   It seems that `, ''` is needless.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kou commented on pull request #4129: ARROW-5146: [Dev] Fix project name inference in merge script
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4129#discussion_r273836795
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/merge_arrow_pr.py
 ##########
 @@ -378,9 +378,8 @@ def merge(self, target_ref='master'):
 
 def cli():
     # Location of your Arrow git clone
-    SEP = os.path.sep
-    ARROW_HOME = os.path.abspath(__file__).rsplit(SEP, 2)[0]
-    PROJECT_NAME = ARROW_HOME.rsplit(SEP, 1)[1]
+    ARROW_HOME = os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__))
+    PROJECT_NAME = os.environ.get('ARROW_PROJECT_NAME', '') or 'arrow'
 
 Review comment:
   Yes. I understood what you want.
   It works for empty value without `, ''`:
   
   ```console
   % python3 -c 'import os; print(os.environ.get("ARROW_PROJECT_NAME") or "arrow")'
   arrow
   % ARROW_PROJECT_NAME= python3 -c 'import os; print(os.environ.get("ARROW_PROJECT_NAME") or "arrow")'
   arrow
   % ARROW_PROJECT_NAME=my-arrow python3 -c 'import os; print(os.environ.get("ARROW_PROJECT_NAME") or "arrow")'
   my-arrow
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
The merge script currently fails with a cryptic message if the parent directory isn't named "arrow":

{code}
$ ./dev/merge_arrow_pr.py 
ARROW_HOME = /home/antoine/arrow/dev
PROJECT_NAME = dev
Which pull request would you like to merge? (e.g. 34): 4113
url = 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dev/pulls/4113'
{'documentation_url': 'https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#get-a-single-pull-request',
 'message': 'Not Found'}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./dev/merge_arrow_pr.py", line 462, in <module>
    cli()
  File "./dev/merge_arrow_pr.py", line 417, in cli
    pr = PullRequest(cmd, github_api, git_remote, jira_con, pr_num)
  File "./dev/merge_arrow_pr.py", line 252, in __init__
    self.url = self._pr_data["url"]
KeyError: 'url'
{code}

PROJECT_HOME is inferred from the current directory name, though it should almost always be "arrow".
